pid_data.process_description: This P&ID illustrates the operational procedure for preparing, transferring, and delivering high-concentration hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) for thrust testing. The process is divided into five phases :Phase 1:The 1000-liter SUS-316 stainless-steel storage tank is thoroughly cleaned to remove impurities. Deionized (DI) and de-oxygenated (DO) water are sent from the 1000-L H₂O tank through the pump and valve V-O to rinse the H2O2 tank. The resulting wastewater is discharged through the drain line via valve V-D. Phase 2:Hydrogen peroxide from 20-liter supply barrels is transferred through valves V-V and V-I into the main 1000-L storage tank using a low-pressure vacuum system connected via valve V-R. Phase 3:H2O2 from the 1000-L tank is distributed into three parallel 145-liter carbon-fiber storage tanks lined with SUS-304 stainless steel via valve V-05. Nitrogen gas is introduced into the main tank to maintain pressurization for transfer(60–80 barA).Phase 4:In the final stage, high-concentration H₂O₂ is delivered from the three 145-L tanks to the catalyst bed for reaction testing. A high-pressure nitrogen system (60–80 barA) propels the peroxide through the transfer lines. Differential pressure transmitters (P6 and P7) monitor and control the flow rate, while thermometer T1 and a CO₂-based cooling system regulate temperature to protect the catalyst from overheating. Once conditioned, the peroxide enters the catalyst bed, marking the completion of the test operation.
system_inputs: Deionized and de-oxygenated water from 1000 L H2O tank
Nitrogen gas (N2) from cylinder via pressure regulator
system_outputs: Waste liquid to drain via WASTE LIQUID line
Venting to atmosphere via venting lines and pressure regulators
H2O2 feed to catalyst bed for thrust test

equipment.name: 1000 L H2O2 Tank
equipment.context: Main SUS-316 hydrogen peroxide storage and transfer tank, equipped with load cell and safety relief

equipment.name: 1000 L H2O Tank
equipment.context: Provides DI/DO water for rinsing the 1000 L H2O2 tank

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 1
equipment.context: First of three parallel carbon-fiber 145 L tanks for H2O2, with load cell and safety relief

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 2
equipment.context: Second of three parallel carbon-fiber 145 L tanks for H2O2, with load cell and safety relief

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 3
equipment.context: Third of three parallel carbon-fiber 145 L tanks for H2O2, with load cell and safety relief

equipment.name: N2 Cylinder
equipment.context: Supplies nitrogen via pressure regulator to 1000 L H2O2 tank for pressurization and venting

equipment.name: N2 Bundle (200 bar) PR-1
equipment.context: First high-pressure nitrogen bundle regulated by PR-1 for pressurizing 145 L tanks and transfer lines

equipment.name: N2 Bundle (200 bar) PR-2
equipment.context: Second high-pressure nitrogen bundle regulated by PR-2 for pressurizing 145 L tanks and transfer lines

equipment.name: Vacuum pump
equipment.context: Provides low-pressure vacuum to transfer H2O2 from 20 L barrels to 1000 L H2O2 tank via V-R

equipment.name: Catalyst bed
equipment.context: Receives conditioned high-concentration H2O2 from 145 L tanks for thrust reaction testing

equipment.name: Full pipe exhaust
equipment.context: Exhaust point for full pipe blowdown via V-07

equipment.name: Weight scale
equipment.context: Used under 20 L H2O2 barrels for mass measurement

equipment.name: Load cell main tank
equipment.context: Measures weight of 1000 L H2O2 tank

equipment.name: Load cell CF tanks
equipment.context: Common indication for 145 L H2O2 tanks weight

utility_lines.flow_direction: From N2_CYL_MAIN into 1000 L H2O2 tank and venting system
utility_lines.context: Used to pressurize and vent main H2O2 tank

utility_lines.flow_direction: From N2_BUNDLE_PR1 and N2_BUNDLE_PR2 into three 145 L H2O2 tanks and their vent lines
utility_lines.context: Pressurizes 145 L tanks (60–80 barA) for transfer and venting

utility_lines.flow_direction: From H2O_TANK_1000L into 1000 L H2O2 tank
utility_lines.context: Used to rinse and clean H2O2 tank

utility_lines.flow_direction: From VAC_PUMP to H2O2 transfer line from 20 L barrels
utility_lines.context: Provides suction to draw H2O2 from barrels into main tank

utility_lines.flow_direction: Through cooling jacket or coil associated with T1 on test feed line
utility_lines.context: Removes heat from H2O2 before entering catalyst bed
